intro: Senecio adonidifolius var. fililobus, commonly known as the slenderleaf groundsels, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage.
